result.execSummary:
The defendant Dwayne Edward Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dwayne Edward Hudson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dwayne Edward Hudson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Cash bail on deposit to apply with the remainder returned to the person who posted it. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised that due to this DV conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with the victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Court advised defendant or penalties for violation of no contact order.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
This time is stayed pending a review on 2/27/15.
***2/27/15:  Commitment to issue for Sheriff Dept to take deft into custody to spend 15 days straight time for non-compliance with conditions of probation.***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwayne Edward Hudson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dwayne Edward Hudson not in court.  George David Kidd appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  P
er email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 15 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Dwayne Edward Hudson in court with attorney Jennifer Marie Severino.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 18 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 2/27/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Cash bail on deposit to apply with the remainder returned to the person who posted it. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered charges dismissed.
.
AS TO COUNT 3 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Dwayne Edward Hudson in court with attorney Jennifer Marie Severino.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Detective Michael Chaperone.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Taranda H

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
